definitions.definition: Expectancy; condition of ownership of real property being undetermined; lapse in succession of ownership of estate, or title.
definitions.example: The proceeds of the estate shall be held in abeyance in an escrow account until the minor reaches age twenty-one.

definitions.definition: Expectancy of a title, its right in existence but its exercise suspended.
definitions.example: The broad pennant of a commodore first class has been in abeyance since 1958, together with the rank.
